intro: Irlbachia alata subsp. arborea, commonly known as the tree-form alata, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually pubescent. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by elliptical, winged fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
